content: knitting manual for original turkish patik footies slippers a touch of the orient on your feet one day my husband brought me a pair of turkish patiks that an acquaintance of mine had given him as a gift aysel that was the name of the woman had knitted them exactly in my size and in my favorite colors for me wow i had never actually owned such beautiful slippers before and they were exactly my style i found out that they were traditional turkish patik translated footies which are very popular in turkey women with a beautiful ajour pattern insert men in a somewhat simpler design of course i wanted to learn to knit this patik - but it took me more than a year until i came to her home after an invitation from aysel s family there we sat together the 70-year-old aysel and me she showed me how to knit these pretty little shoes i knitted together with her for a few hours and wrote everything down exactly in the meantime i have knitted many different patik in different sizes sometimes single-colored sometimes two-colored always looking beautiful therefore i wrote a manual with step-by-step description and pictures which i offer here for download so that many more women can enjoy these special slippers **please note ** these footies are knitted with extra tight stitches this makes them more stable in the daily use either the first pair i knitted was far to loose and the footies were too wide i wasn t used to knit so tight but from the second pair on i was able to knit extra tight and the footies fitted exatly my feet the good thing in the pattern is that you can try on the footies while knitting make the fitting really tight so that the footies stay on your feet like a second skin while walking during the day for my taste the yarn lana grossa cool wool cashmere is ideal for the footies the ajour pattern insert can be worked in a fluffy yarn like rowan kid silk haze with or without glitter taken double-threaded or you can use yarn remnants which are surely waiting somewhere in a drawer for such a beautiful use the turkish patik are a great gift i wish you a lot of joy while knitting my heartfelt thanks again to aysel who took the time to teach me how to knit these beautiful patik -
